description: The desired functionality of the HorizontalPodAutoscaler.

maxReplicas.description: The upper limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up. It cannot be less than `minReplicas`.

metrics.description: The specifications to use for calculating the desired replica count. The maximum value across all metrics will be used. The desired replica count is calculated by multiplying the ratio between the `target` value and the `current` value by the current number of pods.  Ergo, metrics used must decrease as the pod count is increased, and vice-versa. See the individual metric source types for more information about how each `type` of metric must respond. If not set, the default `metrics` will be set to `80%` of average CPU utilization.

minReplicas.description: The lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down.

scaleTargetRef.description: This points to the target resource to scale, and is used to identify the Pods for which metrics should be collected, as well as to actually change the replica count.
